name: BadgerLoop Team
title: And so it begins
content: Hyperloop is a lightning-fast transportation technology that will completely revolutionize modern transit. Since its proposal by Elon Musk in 2013, the innovative idea has evolved into a clearly influential technology of our near-future. Ultimately, the design consists of a levitating pod traveling at nearly 760 miles per hour through an evacuated steel tube. The low pressure minimizes drag forces, while contact-less magnetic levitation further diminishes energy loss. The combination of these features poise Hyperloop as the new world-wide standard for high-speed transportation efficiency.

name: Geek Wire
title: MIT leads in first round of Elon Musk’s Hyperloop contest, but UW is in the race
content: ...Pod Technical Excellence Awards: Badgerloop, University of Wisconsin at Madison...

name: Popular Science
title: Behind the scenes at the SpaceX's Hyperloop Pod Competition
content: Highlights include Lockheed Martin, Halback wheels, and megnetic levitation

name: The Verge
title: Elon Musk made a cameo
content: ...Pod Technical Excellence Awards: Badgerloop, University of Wisconsin at Madison...

name: Bloomberg
title: Musk Gets Rock Star Greeting From Students Vying to Design Hyperloop
content: Teams from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, Delft University in the Netherlands and the University of Wisconsin at Madison were among those winning a chance to build and test their pod designs for the “Hyperloop” transportation system proposed by billionaire Elon Musk.

name: NBC15
title: BadgerLoop Prepares for Texas
content: The BadgerLoop team is creating their version of SpaceX's Hyperloop concept, a new technology that uses air pressures to propel a transportation pod down a tube for fast travel. Brett Sjostrom, Co President of BadgerLoop explains this system like a tube system at a bank. Once the doorway to the tube is closed, the change in air pressure sends the pod shooting down the tube.

name: Univeristy of Wisconsin News
title: UW-Madison places among top teams in SpaceX Hyperloop competition
content: A team of University of Wisconsin—Madison engineering students won 3rd place overall in a worldwide competition to design a pod for shuttling people on a futuristic high-speed transportation system known as the Hyperloop. The UW–Madison BadgerLoop team competed against more than 115 student teams at the first-ever SpaceX Hyperloop pod design competition held Jan. 29-30 at Texas A&M University. The teams came from 27 U.S. states and 20 countries.

name: TIME
title: See the Futuristic Pods That Could Change How We Travel
content: The University of Wisconsin's pod "is designed from the ground up to be completely fail-safe and passenger friendly; it can stop within 200 feet with no power required."

name: The Badger Herald
title: BadgerLoop team prepares for next steps after success in Texas
content: After placing third at Texas A&M University’s Design Weekend in January, University of Wisconsin’s BadgerLoop team hopes to take their HyperLoop pod design off the ground — literally.
